cover: Over several years I demonstrated my ability to thrive under pressure and nurture working relationships as a teacher. My success as a teacher was dependent on reliability and consistency in both meeting and setting expectations, teamwork and clear communication with students and colleagues, and excellent time management
I wanted to keep learning new skills and having always had a passion for problem solving, whether in Maths Olympiads or Philosophical Logic, I decided to retrain as a developer.

I excelled and enjoyed myself on the le Wagon bootcamp, and have been invited back to help the next cohorts as a teaching assistant and a lecturer. Since the bootcamp, I have deepened my understanding of the content covered through helping other students and have stretched myself with mini-projects on further content such as SQL, testing and React.

In my first developer job, I am hoping to find a role where I will be under pressure to deliver from day one, but where I will also have a collaborative team and senior colleagues who I can learn with and from.

lewagon.title: Lecturer & Teaching Assistant
lewagon.text: After excelling as a student on the bootcamp, I have been invited back to work as a teaching assistant and lecturer on the next cohorts of students. I am enjoying the challenge of deepening my understanding of core concepts.

quotes.author: le Wagon student
quotes.text: Explained all my tickets in depth. Always made sure I understood what I was stuck on. Very strong on back end, seemed to really enjoy the problem-solving aspect of coding

bulletpoints: fast-tracked through teaching assistant to lecturer
core OOP principles: Inheritance, Self, Instance vs. Class Methods
taking responsibility to ensure all students progress well and reporting to batch owner

freelancemaths.title: Teacher & Private Tutor
freelancemaths.text: While starting to self-educate in software, I broadened my professional educational experience with supply teaching roles in varied schools and tutoring a wide range of ages and abilities.

quotes.author: F Vitija, Head of Maths
quotes.text: Arthur slotted into the department seamlessly, quickly formed a rapport with his classes that engaged them in their learning and Iâ€™m sure he will be a valuable addition wherever he goes next

bulletpoints: experienced new educational environments, such as the selective private school St Helen's
took initiative to follow department procedures, hitting the ground running on short term contracts
while tutoring, taught advanced topics in A level maths

morpeth.title: Maths Teacher
morpeth.text: I am passionate about education, its social importance, maths and the joy of solving problems. Working as a teacher requires high levels of organisation, communication, intensity and consistency. I consistently received positive feedback on the positive working relationships I had with students and teaching colleagues.

quotes.author: J Reilly, Principal
quotes.text: Children enjoyed learning maths in his lessons. His sense of humour and commitment to the pupils meant that he enjoyed positive relationships with the classes that he taught. He was a supportive colleague and very well-liked by his team.

bulletpoints: managed varied stakeholders through clear and consistent communication
singapore maths mastery curriculum development, resource and assessment design

itembase.title: Channel Partner Manager
itembase.text: After joining in an entry level sales position, I earnt responsibilities including managing key accounts and training new staff.

quotes.author: D Forbes, Director of Sales
quotes.text: After leading anglophone sales results for several months, Arthur earnt his position as one of the first two channel partner managers in this scale-up, leading on growth strategy in partnerships

bulletpoints: sales supported by clear communication skills
coordinated feedback from sales to product and engineering teams

lewagonbootcamp.title: Full Stack Developer Bootcamp
bulletpoints: Frontend: HTML, SCSS, JS ES6, bootstrap

philosopher.title: Specialist Philosopher
bulletpoints: Facilitated a course of sessions for a year 5 group
Developed interest in non-traditional educational techniques

pgce.title: PGCE Maths Teacher Training
bulletpoints: Placements in Lampton School and Richmond Park Academy
Final essay: The benefits of teaching philosophy to school-age children

ba.title: Philosophy BA hons 2: 1
bulletpoints: Specialised in metaphysics,formal logic and language
Dissertation on Wittgenstein's theory of language and meaning
A levels: Maths A, Further Maths B, French A, Economics B

megalithipedia.title: Megalithipedia
bulletpoints: discover megalithic sites such as Stonehenge
connect with fellow appreciators of the ancient
plan walking trips with your friends

rusty.title: Rusty's Amusements
bulletpoints: rent derelict amusement park rides for an unforgettable party experience

passion.title: Passion
passion.text: Since starting the bootcamp I have been excited at the prospect of learning more about programming each day. I look forward to the challenge of finding robust and flexible solutions to challenging problems

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.text: In approaching any problem I would rather spend more time planning a comprehensive and elegant solution, for example using the principles of DDD, than execute the first thing that comes to mind and then debugging until it works... for the time being.

accountability.title: Accountability
accountability.text: As a teacher I was responsible at any given time for the maths education of around 130 students, while managing the concerns of parents, department heads and senior leadership around that. I appreciate the need to be proactive in action and communication with all relevant stakeholders.

humility.title: Humility
humility.text: While confident in my potential as a developer and my ability given my experience level, I know that I understand only the tiniest fraction of the subject. I intend to keep up my pace of learning, collaborating with others at my level and learning from those more experienced.

html.title: HTML
html.text: I am confident and competent working in HTML and extended versions such as .html.erb files in rails or in the context of templating in Vue or React.

css.title: CSS
css.text: I understand how to use plain CSS, and have experience using libraries and frameworks such as bootstrap and tailwind. I have also enjoyed using the SCSS file format.

js.title: JavaScript
js.text: I am trained in ES6 and familiar with older syntax. I have worked in both Vue and React. However, I am also comfortable manipulating the DOM directly where necessary, as you can see with the expanding divs in the experience tab.

responsive.title: Responsive Design
responsive.text: An area in which I still have room to improve and look forward to learning best practices, but I have designed this application site to adapt to different screen sizes.

ruby.title: Ruby
ruby.text: Having worked extensively in Ruby I am highly competent and confident working in it. While learning to code usign Ruby, I have always focussed on the more abstract concepts of control flow and OOP in the knowledge I will want to transfer this understanding to working in other languages in the future.

rails.title: Rails
rails.text: Similar to Ruby, while I have enjoyed working with Rails I expect to work in other frameworks and to that end I have worked to understand the principles of an MVC architecture and the concepts involved in passing information in props.

TDD.title: TDD
TDD.text: While not an expert in TDD, I have experience using packages such as RSPEC for unit and model testing and Capybara for in browser end-to-end testing. You can see an example linked on my github landing page. I look forward to learning more on this in a more practical context in my first role.

SQL.title: SQL
SQL.text: After covering SQL at the bootcamp, I have built upon my knowledge further with a set of exercises linkked on my github landing page. I am comfortable both using SQL directly or in using an ORM such as ActiveRecord. I appreciate there are often inefficiencies in database calls when using an ORM, and I attempt to use techniques such as eager loading where possible.

reactJS.title: ReactJS
reactJS.text: As a personal project I have made a few SPAs in React since leaving the bootcamp. The most notable (although not the prettiest) is the minesweeper app you can find in the projects tab.

vueJS.title: VueJS
vueJS.text: I have self-educated in Vue in recent months and have made sites including this application and a questionnaire that linked to a PHP/Laravel backend.
